alert.note: Alert for Carver; Hennepin; Scott; Sibley (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 12:49AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hennepin, northeastern Sibley, Scott and Carver Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1249 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rogers to near Waconia. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Maple Grove and Cologne around 1255 AM CDT. Champlin, Medina and Carver around 100 AM CDT. Brooklyn Park and Jordan around 105 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Plymouth, Brooklyn Center, Fridley, Minneapolis, Minnetonka, St. Louis Park, Golden Valley, Columbia Heights, Edina, Richfield, MSP International Airport, St. Paul, Bloomington and Mendota Heights. This includes Interstate 94 in Minnesota near mile marker 205. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for central and east central Minnesota.
